column4: Second actor sues Google over 'Innocence of Muslims' movie trailer
column5: A second actor has sued Google Inc over a movie trailer called "Innocence of Muslims" that mocked the Prophet Mohammad and led to riots in 2012  six months after a U.S. appeals court ruled for another actor and ordered the film taken off YouTube.

column4: Hachette writers plan to appeal directly to Amazon's board: NYT
column5: Writers published by Hachette Book Group and their allies are planning to appeal directly to the board of Amazon.com Inc to find a way out of the impasse over e-book prices  the New York Times reported.

column4: UPDATE 1-Deadline near  net neutrality comments top 3 million at U.S. FCC
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 15 The U.S. Federal Communications Commission has received a record 3 million comments from consumers  advocates  companies and lawmakers on proposed new Internet traffic  or "net neutrality " rules as the deadline to formally weigh in approached on Monday.

column4: Deluged with comments  U.S. FCC to continue 'net neutrality' outreach
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 15 U.S. regulators on Monday will formally stop accepting public comments on proposed new Internet traffic  or "net neutrality " rules but will continue reaching out to Americans as they review the controversial regulations.

column4: Fitch Assigns Initial 'BBB' IDR to Enstar; Rates Shelf Registration 'BBB-'
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  September 15 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned an initial 'BBB' Issuer  Default Rating (IDR) to Enstar Group Limited (Enstar). The Rating Outlook is  Stable. In addition  Fitch has assigned a 'BBB-' rating to any unsecured senior  debt securities proposed to be issued under Enstar's recently filed registration  statement. KEY RATING DRIVERS Fitch's assignment of Enstar's ratings reflect the company's solid business  franchise

column4: Tough time to sell Ukraine president's "mouthwatering" candy empire
column5: LONDON  Sept 14 A chance to buy the candy empire of Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko is the kind of opportunity in a fast-growing market that would normally have multinational confectioners - like Nestle or Cadbury's parent Mondelez - drooling at the prospect.

column4: Epirus  Ranbaxy win India approval for arthritis drug copy
column5: Sept 15 Epirus Biopharmaceuticals Inc  said India's drug regulator has approved its copy of a top-selling arthritis treatment  paving the way for its launch in the country early next year.

column4: Netflix will focus on ramping up in Europe over next year

column4: BRIEF-Taiwan UMC's unit Hejian orders equipment from Nikon Precision for T$570.2 mln
column5: * Says unit Hejian Tech orders equipment from Nikon Precision Shanghai for T$570.2 million (18.98 million US dollar)

column4: GE exec says avoided geared design in jet engine battle with Pratt
column5: General Electric Co  avoided using a geared design for its new engine for narrowbody jets because of concerns about weight and reliability  said a top GE executive on Monday as it battles with rival Pratt & Whitney for billions of dollars in engine orders.

column4: Pratt says next F-35 engine deals will cut costs by 7-8 percent
column5: WASHINGTON Pratt & Whitney  a unit of United Technologies Corp  said its contracts with the Pentagon for the next two batches of engines for the Lockheed Martin Corp F-35 fighter jet will result in combined cost savings of 7 percent to 8 percent.

column4: UPDATE 1-Pratt says next F-35 engine deals will cut costs by 7-8 pct
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 15 Pratt & Whitney  a unit of United Technologies Corp  said its contracts with the Pentagon for the next two batches of engines for the Lockheed Martin Corp F-35 fighter jet will result in combined cost savings of 7 percent to 8 percent.

column4: Wells Fargo finds mortgage myths hamper home purchases
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 15 Getting a mortgage in the United States may be easier than many borrowers think  according to a survey released Monday by Wells Fargo & Co  the largest U.S. mortgage lender.
